description.narrative:
Guardian Holdings Limited (GHL or the Company) is one of the Caribbean's largest insurers with total assets of US$3.4 bn and total equity of US$520 mn. It is engaged in the underwriting of long-term life insurance, non-life (property and casualty) insurance and associated investment activities throughout the English- and Dutch-speaking Caribbean. A.M. Best rates GHL's main Life and P&C subsidiaries as A- (Excellent), although with negative outlook, which still puts GHL in the top quartile of global peers in terms of financial strength.
The project entails an equity investment from IFC to strengthen GHLs balance sheet and improve its growth potential in order to increase access to insurance products (e.g., life, property, casualty, etc.) in underserved regions such as the Caribbean and Central America.

With IFC as an important shareholder, the Company is expected to strengthen its position as a leading insurance company in the region and to improve its prospects for expansion into new markets in order to obtain a more diversified exposure to weather risks, a wider customer base and stronger financial and operational capabilities.
The project is expected to improve the growth potential of the Company, and therefore have strong development impact, including: (i) increased access to insurance products (e.g., life, property, casualty, etc.) in underserved regions such as the Caribbean and Central America; (ii) increased competition as the potential of this market segment is further revealed; and (iii) produce demonstration effects through resulting regional business process innovation.
